reviews.text: Rooms are spacious and clean. Stayed in a room with balcony overlooking river. What a nice way to unwind! Hotel serves snacks/drinks at night and good breakfast in morning. Basic workout room. Would definately stay again!
reviews.title: Nice Views!

reviews.text: We stayed a total of ten days for business and some leisure thrown in. Our suite was spacious, overlooked the pool and the water, included a frig and micro, seperate sitting area and a 2 person balcony. The staff were great. Breakfast offered fresh waffles, fruits, cereals, eggs, sausage biscuits, juices, etc. and newspaper, all included. A managers reception in the evening included box wine, Bud, soft drinks, and snacks, on the house. Both girls that work in the breakfast/lounge area are very nice.
reviews.title: Just What We Wanted In A Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeepers were always busy and thorough. Everyone, even the maintenance guys were super nice and accomodating.
reviews.title: Great place!!!

likes.liked: — Location, view, and staff were all excellent!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a stone's throw from downtown and a great place to just hang around the pool/jacuzzi or watch the water from their small pier/gazebo.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but overpriced

likes.disliked: — rooms with windows overlooking pool also overlooked one another

reviews.text: Really a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: We LOVE this Hotel (Just Get the Ducks out of the Pool, Please!)

likes.disliked: — Ducks swimming in the pool and cloudiness of the pool.

reviews.text: The staff (Russell, Mr. Frank, Nelson...) always make me feel so welcome. Reg, the mgr. goes above and beyond to make sure guests are comfortable. The location: there is no better. The rooms: CLEAN and comfortable. I have traveled all over the world but I love coming home to the Comfort Suites in New Bern.
reviews.title: Comfort Suites is my home away from home when I'm in New Bern for business

reviews.text: Do not visit New Bern, NC and especially DO NOT stay at the Comfort Suites, New Bern, NC - Front Street. Move on to Kinston or Washington or Wilmington. My truck was broken into at their parking lot! Hotel Manager/ Owner would not show up while I reported the break-in to the local police. City Police told me crime was bad in New Bern and said the hotel should have better lighting and cameras in the parking area (which the hotel owns) . Hell of a morning. No I'm sorry or what can we do to help. Just dumb look on their face! I asked for a refund and was told they did not FEEL it justified. Sorry, just got $1,100 stolen out of my truck! That's okay, just reported the hotel to the Choice Hotels International, BBB, and my credit card.
reviews.title: Hell and an arrogant Hotel Manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in New Bern

reviews.text: Location is great. Within walking distance of the downtown area. Right next to the river where you can go for a little stroll.
reviews.title: Nice place...

reviews.text: Bed was comfy and the pillows were nice (they weren't the huge marshmallow ones some hotels use). Towels were soft too.
reviews.title: Comfort Suites River Front Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel overall.... service is top notch, beautiful location right on the river and the best part is the Air Conditioning worked very well and kept the room cool all day. I stayed in the Suite with me and my girlfriend for 2 nights we were not bothered at all by the staff and the walls are thick so you can't hear the people next door. Bed is very comfortable not cheap and loved the blankets they provided, very cozy. Only downside is that they did not have the room I wanted available that I reserved 2 months in advance but they still gave me a suite but on the 2nd floor instead of the 3rd.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I've seen....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our last stop on our way home from a motorcylce trip to the outer banks. The rooms were large and clean, the bathroom was immaculate and I was so pleased since I had seen mildew in 2 other bathrooms during this trip. The location is lovely, directly on the river and nice restaurants and shops within walking distance. The staff was extremely friendly and kind but Debi Pittman, Asst. Mgr. went above and beyond after s.o. locked his keys in the trunk. Debi phoned locksmiths & bike shops to help us locate someone who could come and unlock the trunk. I know why they have received the hospitality award several years in a row and think it's well deserved. I would highly recommend this Comfort Inn for a stay in New Bern area.
reviews.title: Inn & Staff - Great !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very friendly, rooms clean and well appointed, no complaints!
reviews.title: Perfect location, pleasant stay

reviews.text: Came for a friend's wedding. Had reserved a Fri/Sat night stay weeks in advance. New baby at home that was sick caused me to need to show up on Saturday rather than Friday. Called the hotel directly on Thursday before the deadline and cancelled Friday night, kept Sat night. Showed up Saturday afternoon after a 6 hour drive and staff gave me a hard time about being a "no show" the night before. I explained I had cancelled the room on Thursday, they acted like they didn't believe me and questioned with whom I had spoken.
reviews.title: Nice location and facilities, staff could have been friendlier

reviews.text: Then, when they overhead me talking about my wife and child at home, they questioned me on how many people were staying in the room.
reviews.title: Charming Stay!

reviews.text: The room was fairly large but most double rooms nowadays seem to have queen beds not doubles like they had here. The staff was very nice. It was March and the outside temp was 50's but the room seemed hot to me even with the A/C on. The breakfast was nothing special but they did have a waffle iron (a plus for me). If money is no object, its a nice place to stay and I would recommend it. If money is an object and you can live without a river view (which is mostly a view of a highway bridge nowadays) there are places equally as good for less money.
reviews.title: A nice place but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and hallways are beautiful and the rooms at first glance are great, however that is where it ends. The air conditioner did not work properly; the room was warm and stuffy. Mold on the ceilings, the bathroom fixtures were old and pitted, cracks and gaps in the caulking. Most important the sanitation grade is 90.5%. I will not eat in and establishment with that grade and had I not needed a place to stay due to construction in my home, I would not have stayed there. I am from this city and will no longer recommend this hotel. The Hampton is just as nice, cleaner and cheaper.
reviews.title: Look closely

likes.liked: — view was nice as it was more comfortable outside the room than inside
likes.disliked: — the money I paid for accomodations of a cheap nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room at the Comfort Suites was fine -- fairly large, good bathroom, clean and in good shape. We paid for a river view -- I have to say we got more of a river "squint" from the one window in the room, but not worth complaining about.
reviews.title: Pretty good place

reviews.text: The front desk staff were really friendly and helpful, offering advice about the restaurants in the restored part of New Bern.
reviews.title: Gracious Southern Hospitality

reviews.text: The breakfast in the morning was OK, and overall the Comfort Suites was satisfactory -- decor and rooms that are bland to the point of sterility, but about what you would expect.
reviews.title: Great view, good in most ways, but 2 problems

likes.disliked: — no one at reception at night
